reviews.review_msg: I literally love Jessica. She is very nice and super approachable to ask questions or get help. She genuinely cares about making sure everyone in the class is actually learning. EASC 209W is a writing course, so lab work is pretty writing intensive. But Jessica's assignments were interesting; her feedback is helpful and she doesn't mark too hard.

This course is a lot of work but you will get a good grade for it. It's a 4 credit writing course so nobody should be surprised that there is more work than some other classes. Jessica is a phenomenal prof, extremely knowledgeable , kind, and passionate about tsunami deposits for which she will offer a world class education.

I felt that the workload was reasonable for a 4 credit writing course and she has accommodated due dates many times. I think she taught the course very well and her research directly applies to the learning goals. She is actually one of the best profs I've ever had and is a genuinely kind person. She is my role model as a researcher/academic.

This class isn't hard, but Jessica and the TA's marking was so unfair. The simplest question would be asked then you're deducted marks for not adding enough detail. She was rude to students and very unforgiving. I knew 100% of material from previous courses and managed 70% on a take home midterm. Super disappointed
